metadata.title: CVE-2019-20446 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.description: In xml.rs in GNOME librsvg before 2.46.2, a crafted SVG file with nested patterns can cause denial of service when passed to the library for processing. The attacker constructs pattern elements so that the number of final rendered objects grows exponentially.

notes.note: mdeslaur> also affects older versions written in C The fixes added to 2.40.21 cause a regression, and upstream will not be fixing them.

criterions.comment: librsvg package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.46.4-1ubuntu1').
